cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 275 miles SSW of Nantucket, Massachusetts
cyclone.trajectory: racing northeastward offshore of the U.S. East Coast toward Nova Scotia and Atlantic Canada

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane/Tropical-storm watches confined to Atlantic Canada; none remain for the North Carolina coast.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warnings for eastern Nova Scotia; tropical-storm warnings from Woods Hole MA to Eastport ME. No warnings along the North Carolina coast.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern U.S. coast from northern Florida through North Carolina experienced prior impacts; current impacts shifting to New England and Atlantic Canada.
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm to occasional hurricane-force gusts occurred early 6 Sep; winds now diminishing as the storm accelerates away.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Water levels along the Cape Fear coast briefly rose 2–5 ft above ground level but are now receding.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands produced 6–10 inches of rain in portions of southeastern North Carolina, including the Wilmington area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents will persist for another day even as the center moves away.
